alert.note: Alert for Del Norte Interior; Northeastern Mendocino Interior; Northern Humboldt Interior; Northern Lake County; Northern Trinity; Northwestern Mendocino Interior; Southern Humboldt Interior; Southern Trinity; Southwestern Humboldt (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 26 at 2:56PM PST until December 27 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...HEAVY MOUNTAIN SNOW EXPECTED DURING THE CHRISTMAS HOLIDAY... .A series of cold upper level storm systems lowered snow levels to around 500 to 1000 feet early this morning. Snow levels have risen to 1500 feet this afternoon but will likely fall again to below 500 feet early Monday. Periods of heavy showers spreading across the cold airmass will favor significant mountain snowfall lasting through Monday morning. A dusting of snow is possible down to sea level. Travel across mountain roadways and highway passes will subsequently be difficult if not impossible. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 6 to 20 inches above 2000 feet and 1 to 5 inches at lower elevations. * WHERE...Portions of northwest California. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state of California can be obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.
